title: Police arrest rucksack-wearing protester at huge anti-Brexit protest
text:
Police have dramatically arrested a man outside Parliament amid huge anti Brexit protests on Super Saturday.

Several armed officers pinned the man who was wearing a rucksack to the ground in New Palace Yard.

It is believed he was trying to pass through turnstiles into a the Commons where access is restricted to pass holders.

Police have dramatically arrested a man outside Parliament amid huge anti Brexit protests

Officers who searched him were seen taking a pass that would have granted him entry to the public gallery.

The man was wearing a quilted green jacket, dark jeans and holding a camera bag, according to The Mirror.

A Westminster insider said he had been 'behaving strangely'.

He was handcuffed and then led away to a police van.

Officers who searched him were seen taking a pass that would have granted him entry to the public gallery

A spokesman for House of Commons authorities: 'We are aware of an incident involving a visitor in a public area of the Parliamentary estate.

'Security staff and the police attended and the situation has been resolved.'

The arrest comes on a historic day as parliament is sitting on a Saturday for the first time since 1982.

MPs are debating Boris Johnson's eleventh-hour Brexit agreement which he struck with the bloc on Thursday.
description: Police have dramatically arrested a man outside Parliament amid huge anti Brexit protests on Super Saturday. Several officers pinned the man who was wearing a rucksack to the ground.
